messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] unschooling in SC, was Digest Number 409
messages.msgSnippet: Yes---log on to SchoolsOutSupport@yahoogroups.com for the SC unschoolers group. Leslie s begging for a Mom s Night Out in Columbia one day soon, and I ve been
messages.messageBody:
Yes---log on to SchoolsOutSupport@yahoogroups.com for the SC
unschoolers' group. Leslie's begging for a Mom's Night Out in Columbia
one day soon, and I've been trying to find a date for a CiCi's pizza
and Park Day in these next two weeks.

We'll look for you at SOS!

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
October 6-9, 2005
http://liveandlearnconference.org

-----Original Message-----
From: Leslie530@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tue, 26 Apr 2005 13:17:34 EDT
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] unschooling in SC, was Digest Number 409



In a message dated 4/26/2005 8:39:55 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time,
hopefull2005@... writes:

Is there anyone who lives in SC who has any advice for me as far as
the laws
go? I looked over the laws and it looks like option #3 would be the
best
one (because you don't have to deal with the public schools) but I was
hoping
somebody could give me some real life experience with SC law and
unschooling.

Thanks!!

Kim : )



**************

Hi Kim, I'm not sure if anyone responded yet because my email inbox is
a
mess! So at the risk of being redundant....

yes, Option 3 is the way to go. I can give you more info, maybe
off-list?

We moved here from Jacksonville, NC last year and are a military
family. We
are in Beaufort, where are you going to be?

Kelly (one of this list's moderators) also has the schoolsoutsupport
yahoo
group that is a state-wide unschoolers' list.

Good luck with your move....I am still not completely unpacked! Ack!

Leslie in (Beaufort) SC
